entry.title: Reinventing B2B Customer Experiences with the SAP B2B Self-Service Portal
entry.content:
Why B2B Needs a Makeover

Today’s B2B customers expect the same seamless, personalised, and transparent experiences they enjoy as consumers. Relying only on sales representatives and support desks is no longer enough. Customers want 24/7 access, instant transparency, and simplified digital processes.

That’s where the SAP B2B Self-Service Portal comes in. More than just a convenience layer, it digitalizes routine customer interactions—such as tracking orders, downloading invoices, and making online payments—while freeing sales and support teams to focus on strategic, value-driven conversations with customers.

The Challenges B2B Organisations Face

Across industries, B2B companies and its Customers often struggle with the below challenges:

These issues directly affect both customer satisfaction, business operation efficiencies and cash flow.

SAP B2B Self-Service Portal: A Digital Entry Point

SAP’s foundational B2B Self-Service Portal , seamlessly integrated with SAP S/4HANA, provides a digital entry point for customer engagement—without the complexity of a full transactional commerce platform.

What it Delivers

  • Transparency: Customers can track orders, invoices, and payment status in real-time.
  • Convenience: Self-service for downloads, requests, and account management.
  • Efficiency: Routine tasks shift from support desks to the portal, reducing sales friction.
  • Consistency: Data is synced directly with SAP S/4HANA for reliable, real-time accuracy.

This makes the portal an ideal launchpad for digital engagement, giving organisations a fast, lightweight way to improve customer experience and operational efficiency.

Key Capabilities of the Foundational B2B Self Service Portal

  • Account Management – login, password, and organisation management
  • Orders – order lists, details, and sync from S/4HANA
  • Financials – invoices, credit notes, credit limits, invoice downloads
  • Content Management – home page, promo banners, contact forms
  • Master Data Integration – B2B units and customers
  • Payments (Optional) – payment processing, reconciliation, and tracking

From Self-Service to Full B2B Commerce

The journey doesn’t stop with a self-service portal—it’s only the beginning. The portal is designed to evolve with organisation's business needs as below.

Step1: Start with a non-transactional SAP B2B Foundational Self-Service Portal to track Orders, View/download Invoices and make Payments online 

Step2: Upgrade to a full scale transactional SAP Commerce Cloud to enable advanced capabilities such as online ordering, personalised catalogs, real-time pricing with inventory management and many more.

Step3: Extend into a connected commerce ecosystem by integrating with other SAP CX Solutions creating a complete digital experience for both customers and business teams.

Getting Started with SAP Activation Services

To accelerate adoption, SAP provides a baseline Activation Service that quickly sets up the portal. With the support of an SAP Partner, this baseline can be extended into a full Go-Live service, ensuring smooth rollout and faster time-to-market.

For organisations looking to improve cash flow, the SAP Digital Payments Add-On can be integrated. This enables online invoice payments with automatic reconciliation in SAP S/4HANA Finance, reducing manual effort, speeding up collections, and giving finance teams real-time visibility into outstanding balances.

Prerequisites and Services

  • SAP B2B Self-Service Portal Add-On - Link
  • SAP Digital Payments Add-On – Link
  • SAP BTP Integration Suite 
  • Services:  Baseline Activation + Go-Live Services with SAP Partners

Conclusion: From “Nice-to-Have” to “Must-Have”

In today’s digital-first world, a B2B Self-Service Portal is no longer optional. It is essential for organizations that want to remain competitive by delivering transparency, speed, and convenience to customers—while freeing sales and support teams to focus on relationship-building and growth.

And this is just the beginning. With SAP Commerce Cloud, businesses can expand from self-service to full-fledged B2B e-commerce, unlocking advanced capabilities that transform the portal into a comprehensive, connected commerce platform— redefining what B2B customer experience can be.

entry.title: Replication of contracts from SAP SOM to CI /FI-CA only
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are testing the replication of subscription contracts from SAP SOM to SAP CI. Currently, the fulfillment steps in the subscription contract throw the following error (see snapshot):

“Joint replication of all master data to SAP CC not active.”

Upon investigation, this appears to be caused by the ODI distribution step CL_CRM_ISX_ORDER_MD_ERP_MCC (Step Type: PCEA).

SAP Convergent Charging (CC) is not activated in our S/4 system. We want subscription contracts to be distributed as provider contracts only to SAP Convergent Invoicing (CI). Could you please advise on how to achieve this? Any guidance would be greatly appreciated.

Best Regards,

Al
